titles: His Maiesties speech at Shrewsbury, on Michaelmas Eve last, to the gentry and commons of the county of Salop, there assembled.
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
notes: Promises the army shall not commit disorders. His is melting down his own plate for money, Asks them to imitate their enemies and contribute. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Finance --  Early works to 1800.
